com.sk89q.intake.parametric

Class ParametricBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sk89q.intake.parametric.ParametricBuilder

  • public class ParametricBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates CommandCallables from methods in an object that have been annotated with Command. The types of the method's parameters are read to determine the arguments that will be passed when the method is invoked. The types of arguments that are supported (String, int, domain-specific objects, etc.) depends on the Bindings that are registered on this class.
    See Also:
    defines a command, defines a flag

      • ParametricBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • addBinding

        public void addBinding(Binding binding,
                       @Nullable
                       java.lang.reflect.Type... type)
        Add a binding for a given type or classifier (annotation).

        Whenever a method parameter is encountered, a binding must be found for it so that it can be called later to consume the stack of arguments provided by the user and return an object that is later passed to Method.invoke(Object, Object...).

        Normally, a Type is used to discern between different bindings, but if this is not specific enough, an annotation can be defined and used. This makes it a "classifier" and it will take precedence over the base type. For example, even if there is a binding that handles String parameters, a special @MyArg annotation can be assigned to a String parameter, which will cause the ImmutableBiMap.Builder to consult the Binding associated with @MyArg rather than with the binding for the String type.

        Parameters:
        binding - the binding
        type - a list of types (if specified) to override the binding's types

      • addInvokeListener

        public void addInvokeListener(InvokeListener listener)
        Attach an invocation listener.

        Invocation handlers are called in order that their listeners are registered with a ParametricBuilder. It is not guaranteed that a listener may be called, in the case of a CommandException being thrown at any time before the appropriate listener or handler is called. It is possible for a InvokeHandler#preInvoke(Object, Method, ParameterData[], Object[], CommandContext) to be called for a invocation handler, but not the associated InvokeHandler#postInvoke(Object, Method, ParameterData[], Object[], CommandContext).

        An example of an invocation listener is one to handle Require, by first checking to see if permission is available in a InvokeHandler#preInvoke(Object, Method, ParameterData[], Object[], CommandContext) call. If permission is not found, then an appropriate CommandException can be thrown to cease invocation.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener
        See Also:
        the handler

      • addExceptionConverter

        public void addExceptionConverter(ExceptionConverter converter)
        Attach an exception converter to this builder in order to wrap unknown Throwables into known CommandExceptions.

        Exception converters are called in order that they are registered.

        Parameters:
        converter - the converter
        See Also:
        for an explanation

      • getCommandExecutor

        public java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService getCommandExecutor()
        Get the executor service used to invoke the actual command.

        Bindings will still be resolved in the thread in which the callable was called.

        Returns:
        the command executor

      • setCommandExecutor

        Set the executor service used to invoke the actual command.

        Bindings will still be resolved in the thread in which the callable was called.

      • registerMethodsAsCommands

        public void registerMethodsAsCommands(Dispatcher dispatcher,
                                      java.lang.Object object)
                               throws ParametricException
        Build a list of commands from methods specially annotated with Command (and other relevant annotations) and register them all with the given Dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        dispatcher - the dispatcher to register commands with
        object - the object contain the methods
        Throws:
        ParametricException - thrown if the commands cannot be registered
